intro: Stellaria schlechtendaliana, commonly known as the Schlechtendalian starwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and chickweed. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Stellaria schlechtendaliana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
